title: Making Open and Machine Readable the New Default for Government Information

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes that government information should be open and easily accessible in machine-readable formats by default to promote transparency, innovation, and economic growth. It directs agencies to implement policies and practices ensuring data is discoverable and usable, while protecting privacy, confidentiality, and national security.
potential_concerns: Increased openness and machine-readable data may inadvertently expose sensitive personal information, posing privacy risks to individuals with disabilities and chronic illnesses despite safeguards (themes: data-privacy, records-classification-transparency).

The cost and complexity of implementing open data standards could increase burdens on taxpayers and smaller agencies, possibly diverting resources from other priorities (themes: government-efficiency, government-it-modernization).

Entrepreneurs and small business owners relying on government data might face inconsistencies or delays if agencies struggle to fully comply with deadlines or standards, limiting the potential economic benefits (themes: government-efficiency, government-it-modernization).

Scientific researchers and technology workers could encounter challenges integrating diverse data sets if interoperability standards are not well-defined, potentially limiting innovation despite data availability (themes: government-it-modernization).
